p: Two small contigs were found showing significant similarity with RNA virus sequences. The first one was 430 nt in length and exhibited highest identity with a hypothetical protein encoded by Beihai tombus-like virus 6 (41.13% sequence identity; 97% coverage; E-value = 4e-17; GenBank access: APG76145.1), isolated from a pool of marine crustaceans within the genus Penaeidae [ 3]. The second contig has 330 nt and showed highest identity with NfV-1 polyprotein (59.49% sequence identity; 93% coverage; E-value = 2e−4; GenBank access: AOC55078.1) from tawny crazy ant Nylanderia fulva [ 50].
